A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. This is, without a doubt, one of my favorite Columbo episodes ever. The acting is very well done, the music is very catchy, the script and dialogue are quite clever and witty in many places – but I really love it for other reasons as well.

Leland follows the story of Leland P. Fitzgerald (Ryan Gosling), a disaffected teenager who has apparently murdered a severely retarded peer, the brother of his would-be lover and mentally unstable classmate Laura (Rachel McAdams). This is essentially a coming-of-age story set in contemporary Dayton, Ohio. A River Runs Through It is based on the true story of two fly fishing brothers, Norman and Paul, (Brad Pitt and Craig Sheffer) whose Reverend father (Tom Skerritt) tries to teach them life’s lessons by way of Fly Fishing. Comedy and drama with sprinkles of justifiable violence.
Based on real life events it is not for the faint hearted but will give you a fresh perspective of the world we live in.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on his friendship with people related to him: Ichihara Uichiro, Tomita Tamiji (Tomoko Naraoka), Fujiwara Yoshie (Mineko Nomachi).
